text:
Hey everyone. I have a tough time sometimes as I go through bouts of self doubt (or Impostor syndrome) and a heightened sense of self importance (sometimes I feel my opinions matter more than they really do in systems/cultures and I feel frustrated when my ideas are not acted upon. I sometimes feel I have failed in convincing others).

Posting in this channel as I think it has/will impact my career choices as I work anywhere/look out for new opportunities, couldn’t find a more relevant channel for now (please redirect if needed). I have started sharing this with my therapist now and it is helping but any experiences here from people who have faced it/facing it will help me to learn and grow.

I have started sharing this with my therapist now and it is helping but any experiences here from people who have faced it/facing it will help me to learn and grow.

text: Bhai - i feel you. Have you tried building your own system and use it fully to validate mismatches between your assumptions and targeted end results?

elements.text: Bhai - i feel you. Have you tried building your own system and use it fully to validate mismatches between your assumptions and targeted end results?

text: I try to <@U02UZ4T10PQ>. I have started to note down points of conflict. one thing which has started to help is if I note down my concern and can’t back it up with evidence upon deeper reflection, it doesn’t impact me much after that. But the self awareness is not as strong sometimes and can’t get too process oriented as well, then I will be harsh on myself for not doing a good job with the process :smile:

elements.text: I try to

. text: Agreed, but the goal here is to build trust in your own system and you in the process. Maybe your limiting belief here is by penning down, you are being harsh on yourself.

text:
1. Name of company- Venly
2. Role- Product Marketer
3. Experience: min 5years in e product or marketing role.
5.1: this person will lead the GTM strategy, set goals and KPIs for specific products and services within the Venly tech stack.
5.2: depending on the product it can be lead generation, user acquisition, user retention
5.3: Marketing budget for Venly overall is around 1M this year (counting closing of seriesA)
6. depending on experience and location, senior role around 70k USD / Year

Hey folks! Hope you are doing well. Happy to be posting a job opening. Looking to fill 2-3 positions.

If your profile is relevant, you could apply here-
<https://www.venly.io/careers#open-positions|https://www.venly.io/careers#open-positions>

This is a permanently remote role.
Dm if you any queries. Cheers!

text:
<@U031QKGPNRK> - I relate to this a lot. I have been trying to put this into words for a while now but couldn't have done it better than you. That "failed to convince others" bit has happened quite a few times with me and it is supremely frustrating.

To distil my thoughts down, to the best of my current capabilities, I feel the following points help me in managing these feelings better:

1) The core of it all is to learn - to fill the existing gaps and broaden & deepen the breadth and depth of my current knowledge, respectively.

2) If I am unable to convince others of my idea then I try to research and understand in detail why the other person's idea/suggestion won over mine. Then use my learnings next time I pitch something - be it in the structure of my pitch or/and its contents.

3) If I successfully convince others that my ideas/suggestions/proposals are the better option, I still try to get into the depth of it to understand how it can fail. My ideas might seem better to me than others but I know they have gaps and flaws too. So better get to the bottom of it to make sure things are as fine in the end as they possibly can be. 

4) Whenever I feel the feelings that you have mentioned about, I just remind myself that my own ideas, however good they might seem to me, have/can have/may have gaps or flaws, like I mentioned earlier. Corollary that I draw from this - good ideas can come other people too, though even those may have their own set of flaws when put under the microscope, even though superficially it may have gathered traction and convinced most others/concerned key stakeholder of its 'impactfulness'. At the end of it, whether it's my idea or someone else's, despite what I am feeling, i try to focus on getting the required results. But, quite a lot of things work under limitations and at the end of it you have to make do with what you have, if you can't improve the current system anyhow.

5) When i feel down and I seem like a fraud to myself (the imposter syndrome you talked about), it helps to think about all the times I pulled stuff off successfully, know that I have a natural inclination to punch more holes in me and my thoughts, and remember the times when it felt so in the past but how that also just passed by. 

I tried to be as coherent as I could. Not sure about how successful I was. :sweat_smile:
 
In case you want to discuss this further, do connect. Would be happy to chat further on this.

text: Thanks for opening up so honestly <@U02V75V0YBX>. Much appreciated. I related to 3 and 4 the most. I think I have a tendency to overlook the analysis need post campaigns/experiments when I have convinced others to adapt a new strategy. to double down on learning and scale it. Please don’t double check on your way of communication when its sincere and honest. Thanks again for such a detailed breakdown. will reach out to you in coming days as I process my thoughts better

elements.text: Thanks for opening up so honestly

. Much appreciated. I related to 3 and 4 the most. I think I have a tendency to overlook the analysis need post campaigns/experiments when I have convinced others to adapt a new strategy. to double down on learning and scale it. Please don’t double check on your way of communication when its sincere and honest. Thanks again for such a detailed breakdown. will reach out to you in coming days as I process my thoughts better

text:
No worries, <@U031QKGPNRK>. Hope it helps somehow. 

Yeah, I can somehow understand 3 and 4 feeling relatable. 3 is something I do quite often. :sweat_smile:

Also, just for context, the first point is more of a preventive action for me, to avoid falling into the trap of such thoughts and that is the reason why i mentioned it. The rest are more of reactive/corrective measures.

text:
Hi Everyone,
*PLEASE hear me out* :slightly_smiling_face: 

Sharing the profile of a school-time classmate - Kreshi,  *to share any suitable entry-level job with her*

1. She's a bread earner for her family and makes 0 fuss about it. 
2. *Despite earning less than half of what I earn, her drive, and work ethic inspire me more than Forrest Gump.* 
3. She's just someone who's from a less fortunate background and hence not able to get the grounds to fight fair for her career until late.
4. I can vouch for her patience and crazy work ethic.
5. This woman's an asset even in toxic work environments, the best.
6. 4 months into her new job, she's already about to get promoted over and before her peers!
*I'm just trying to help her get a fair shot in a good culture once and watch her become a company asset.*

_*She's a Research Analyst in the Brand Protection domain, has experience in client and 3rd party dealings, and has also worked with Wipro in technical client mgmt._

Thank you for reading such a long message, let's try to help her as a community :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
Understand your situation <@U031QKGPNRK>, what you're or you have been facing, many of us have been in this situation.

From what I can understand, there seems 2 causes only
• You're able to win in convincing the team regarding your idea
• You're not able to and your idea is not acted upon
Just remember few things

Your decision or mindset should be indifferent to both the type of situation, because it's not about individual so try not to take the situation on yourself the idea is collective and the outcome would be collective where in as a leader you must embrace the diversity and even if the idea is not yours and the team fails the learnings are collective.

Also, as many people fall prey to this, don't listen to the points or arguements just to make a counter arguement. It's not about winning or losing.

Can only say, don't attach yourself to ideas or their acceptance.

P.S: These are my personal opinions, you may or may not resonate with it.

Also, as many people fall prey to this, don't listen to the points or arguements just to make a counter arguement. It's not about winning or losing.
